1. Consider the data $Y_1, Y_2, \ldots, Y_n$ such that
$$
Y_i \sim N(\mu, \sigma^2). 
$$
Let 
$$
\bar{Y} = \frac{1}{n}\sum^n_{i = 1}Y_i. 
$$
    a. Show that
$$
E[\bar Y] = \mu.
$$
```{r, results='asis'}
marks(3)
```
\begin{solutions}
$$
\begin{aligned}
E[\bar Y] &= 
E\left[
\frac{1}{n}\sum^n_{i = 1}Y_i
\right]\\
&= \frac{1}{n}\sum^n_{i = 1}E[Y_i]\\
&= \frac{1}{n}\sum^n_{i = 1}\mu\\
&= \mu. 
\end{aligned}
$$
\end{solutions}

